meanings.definition: Threatening or menacing in appearance or manner.
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds looked minacious, signaling an approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: The guard's minacious glare made the intruder rethink their actions.
meanings.sent3: The minacious shadow of the tree made the squirrel jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The minacious growl of the dog warned the hiker to stay back.
meanings.sent5: The minacious stranger's stare sent shivers down her spine.

meanings.sent1: His minacious tone made it clear he was not joking.
meanings.sent2: The letter's minacious language left her feeling uneasy.
meanings.sent3: The cat's minacious meow demanded attention for its empty food bowl.
meanings.sent4: The minacious message in the movie left the audience on edge.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's minacious look silenced the noisy classroom.
